alert.note: Alert for Northern Trinity; Southern Trinity (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 19 at 2:03PM PST until December 21 at 7:00PM PST by NWS Eureka
info.description: ...Quick-hitting Winter Storm to bring Tricky Travel Conditions in Trinity County on Tuesday... .The first in several rounds of precipitation expected to impact northwest California through the holiday weekend will arrive in Trinity County Tuesday morning. While snow levels will be on the rise across areas to the west and southwest, snow levels in Trinity County will start off around 2000 to 2500 feet Tuesday morning. This may allow for some minor accumulations even at Weaverville, but snow levels should rise above 3000 feet later in the day or Tuesday night. Precipitation will taper off Tuesday evening. Snow levels are expected to be mainly above 4000 feet with the next round or two of precipitation Wednesday into Thursday, before much colder air begins flowing in late Thursday through the weekend. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM TO 7 PM PST TUESDAY ABOVE 2500 FEET... * WHAT...Wet snow expected above 2500 feet. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 5 inches. Minor accumulations possible around Weaverville. * WHERE...Trinity County. * WHEN...From 4 AM to 7 PM PST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be difficult over mountain passes along Highways 299, 3 and 36. Plan on slippery and potentially snow- covered roads. Chains may be required over some mountain passes.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state of California can be obtained by calling 1-800-GAS-ROAD.
